title: Theodore Roosevelt National Park: NPS Centennial
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     NPS Centennial            NPS Centennial       The National Park Service turns 100 on August 25, 2016. As we lead up to the centennial, we invite you to participate in Find Your Park Experiences to learn, discover, be inspired, or simply have fun in national parks. Find Your Park Experiences offer unique opportunities to explore national parks both in person and online. Check out the experiences in this park or search all experiences to identify an opportunity that matches your interests. You can also share your national park story at FindYourPark.com. A Call to Action remains the foundation for our 2016 centennial preparations. It is the National Park Service's blueprint for the future, outlining the innovative work we want to accomplish. Theodore Roosevelt National Park is a big part of this effort. Take a look at what we're doing and get involved!   Experiences      Birding in D.C.  Even in the bustling city of Washington, D.C., opportunities to spot a wide variety of birds abound in an unusual concentration of national parks. Birding is a leisurely hobby that can be done anywhere at any time. Read more   Enjoy Solitude and Wide Open Space  Do you need time to relax, get away from hectic schedules and deadlines, and recharge your spirit? Come to Tallgrass Prairie National Preserve and experience over 40 miles of hiking trails, endless skies, and quiet. There are places on the preserve where you see only nature; nothing human made. Places where you only hear the wind rustling the grass and the grasshoppers sing. Bring a picnic, find a nice spot, and enjoy some time to yourself as nature helps rejuvenate the soul. Read more   Go Where the Buffalonians Roam  What do chicken wings, Theodore Roosevelt, Cheerios, and the Erie Canal have in common? Explore New York’s second largest city and you’ll quickly find out. Visit the site where Theodore Roosevelt took the oath of office, then head to Buffalo's vibrant waterfront and discover the heart of the city transformed by the Erie Canal in 1825. Choose from boating, cycling, and hiking options to add active adventure to your journey. Read more      Call to Action Projects      BadgerQuest Digs for Success  For the 5th year, students from the University of Wisconsin-Madison's "BadgerQuest" program assisted with backountry projects at Theodore Roosevelt National Park. These students travel around the world helping with projects which focus on community service and environmental consciousness. Read more
